characters.name: Master Ace
intro: PC: Oh wonderful… another inferior creature, here to bother me.
PC: <Sigh>  Well, you’re hardly worth my time…

attacks.name: Troll
dialog: PC posts a particularly unkind comment about you on the internet.  It directly targets your feels.
PC: Oh look, your shame is trending.

attacks.name: Sound Blaster
dialog: PC turns the speakers up to 11. It’s like an earthquake for your ears.

attacks.name: Blast Processing
dialog: PC: Nice video card, newbie.  Here’s a thought for you… G-P-U-SUCK.
It’s not a great joke, but it starts a pun thread online all the same.  You feel embarrassed about each and every reply.

attacks.name: Battering RAM
dialog: PC: This will be one for the memory book!
PC smashes into you with the full weight of a CRT monitor.
You have a feeling you’ll be randomly accessing the memory of this injury for weeks.

conversations.prompt: PC: Sigh, to think I have to waste my precious cycles deleting you...

replies.text: Don’t get out much, do you?
followup: Master Ace glances at his wires, and looks really embarrassed.
PC: Some of us don’t need portability…
PC: ...because we make up for it with raw power!
PC looks mildly irritated.

replies.text: What a lovely shade of beige!
followup: PC looks mildly irritated.

conversations.prompt: PC: Nice cartridges, console peasant.  I could emulate you without breaking a sweat.

replies.text: Watch out, it’s a power outage!
followup: PC: Oh no!  But I won’t be shut down properly!
Master Ace looks around in terror, and then looks really embarrassed.
PC: Hey, that’s not funny...
PC: ...not all of us have batteries, you know...

replies.text: Don’t you have a basement to live in?
followup: PC looks mildly irritated.

replies.text: That’s a great cardboard box impression.
followup: PC looks pretty annoyed.

conversations.prompt: PC: Okay, so I might not be portable, but I am a machine of both pleasure and productivity!

replies.text: How are those driver conflicts going?
followup: Master Ace thinks about all the old games and software he can’t run, and then looks really embarrassed.
PC: I’m sure I could get those things working if I just…
PC: ...spend a couple days reinstalling old operating systems...
PC: ...and drivers... and...
PC looks pretty annoyed.

replies.text: I bet spreadsheets are a blast!
followup: PC looks mildly irritated.

conversations.prompt: PC: I will admit you have your place in the world… but you lack versatility!  Adaptability!  Customizability!

replies.text: At least I know who I am.
followup: Master Ace gets kind of quiet, and looks pretty sad.

replies.text: And room for big ugly stickers?
followup: PC looks pretty annoyed.
PC looks mildly irritated.

replies: Master Ace looks longingly at your camera, and quietly curses his age.
PC: Say, you don’t have PC drivers for that fine camera of yours, do you?
PC: I have attractive people to video chat with, you see... sigh... maybe someday.
Master Ace tries to hide a look of pity... and then very much stops trying to hide it.
PC: You’re trying to impress ME with that tiny screen?
PC: Come back when that thing is 17 inches and 50 pounds, and then we’ll talk...
Master Ace sees the printer and instinctively recoils in horror.
PC: Oh no... a printer... get that thing away from me! Ugh!
PC: I still have nightmares about my last clogged print queue.  <Shudder>
Master Ace scoffs at your receiver, and smiles derisively.
PC: Oh please, you console pleb. I invented the internet.

win: PC: You know... even for all of this power... I do sometimes wonder what my purpose truly is.
PC: Do I play games? ...Write novels? ...Balance checkbooks?
PC: ...or just sit here, day after day, browsing social media...?
PC sighs, and seems wistful over many misspent hours.
PC: ...you've given me a lot to think about, little friend.
PC: I'd like to be alone for a while. Maybe some silent reflection would help.
PC: Tell you what. Why don't you take these speakers? I won't be needing them for a while.
PC: I wish you luck in the battles ahead. You're more powerful than you look.
PC: ...not as powerful as me, of course, console filth. ...but... you'll be fine. Good luck.
lose: PC: Let's face it, you don't stand much of a chance against the PC Master Ace.
PC: Don't bother me again until you have better hardware, console peasant.
